Hydras:

"Yesss"hissed Hydras "Do you know my dear Maxima, that you have a high 
vitues that every Decepticon leader want to see in his troops??? You're 
cunning, you're brave, You're loyal... If I would have ten like you I would 
had conquestered Cybertron... and Now I know that that it's possible..."

>airly2002@... writes:
>
>
> > "My dear and Brave Maxima"said the male while he took her hand"Your
> > Loyalty will have a big rewarded. Belive it or not, I can apreciate
> > a real Loyal Decepticon... I never treason a decepticon who's fully
> > loyal to me... "and said with a diferent tone "We can destroy
> > together Maximal with their patetic ancestors, but we need to know
> > where the Ark is... and know what Maximals knows about the ark "
>
>Not looking down at her paw in his. But she seemed to narrow her optics 
>just
>slightly as she seemed to stiffen.
>
>But at the mention of destroying the Autobots as well as the Maximals 
>brought
>her enormus joy. No .. not joy... but pleasure. Satisfaction. She would 
>enjoy
>seeing them, watching them, as they slowly were terminated. Ahhh.. how she
>missed terminating them, watching them suffer. Her optics seemed to sparkle
>at the thought of termination of her loathed enemies. If she were in her 
>old
>form, her crimson optics would have glowed.
>
>She smirked. Then a wicked laugh came from her. "The location of the Ark is
>what you seek?" Oh, how she loved it when she held power in her grasp.
>Though.. she never wished to abuse it like what Starscream did on 
>occassion.
>
>Still smirking. "& Loyalty is what you have, mighty Hydras. I remain ever
>loyal to Megatron & you are, in a manner of speaking, Megatron. I will 
>never
>betray my oath.. I will never betray my leader."
>
>"As to rewards..." she stopped. There was something she never thought 
>about.
>The only desire she had for this long was to see the Autobots termainted,
>suffer. To see her comrades victorious. To see her Leader conquer. &.. to 
>be
>the best Decepticon that Megatron ever had.
>
>Megatron....
